newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela Fogade lowers Alucasa price to $40 mln.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela Fogade lowers Alucasa price to $40 mln.

text.p: Venezuela's state Deposits Guarantee Fund (Fogade) announced Monday that it had set a minimum price of $40 million for small aluminum company Alucasa, down from $45 million set for an earlier, postponed auction.
Fogade suspended that auction just two days short of the Aug. 29 sale to allow potential bidders more time to assess the company.

U.S. companies Reynolds Metals Co and Aluminum Company of America (Alcoa) and Japan's Marubeni, are among those to have visited the information room for Alucasa which boasts a 20,000 tonnes per year capacity.

Alucasa is 49 percent owned by state privatization body the Venezuelan Investment Fund (FIV) and 51 percent owned by a consortium of 16 private investors and banks, some of which were taken over by FOGADE during the 1994-5 banking crisis.
